events.name: Cloud Kick-Off
events.description:
This meeting will kick off our new meetup group as well as get attendees started with cloud computing.

Specifically, this is an intro to cloud computing: How to set up a virtual machine, add a web server, and secure it with SSH (https), all done for free. Depending on how long that takes, the extra topic we might explore (but probably won't want to overwhelm people with) is setting up SFTP file transfers to the server.

Our measurement of having a successful talk will be to see if you've spun up your own machines afterwards. :)

There will be 3 parts to the session:
- mingle
- presentation
- questions

We’ll also have a brief introduction of our operational principles as a GDG meetup.

We hope to see you there! Parking/Transit details below:
----------

Parking

The DesignLab is at 30 E Del Mar Blvd, Pasadena, CA. You probably won't find street parking nearby, but please see this Google map (https://www.google.com/maps/d/edit?mid=z336KXOi6I8Q.kWuP10Ksdh4Y) showing the DesignLab location and nearby parking structures.

-----------

Public Transportation

Using the Metro Goldline trains is quick and easy. It takes about 20 mins from Union Station in downtown LA to Del Mar Station, which is less than 2 minutes walk from our front door. Trains run about every 10 mins during the day and 20 mins at night from 11pm-2am.

There are also buses that serve Old Town Pasadena. The nearest intersection is FAIR OAKS/DEL MAR BLVD, PASADENA, CA 91105. You can find timetables or use the Metro Trip Planner at metro.net

events.name: Python in the Cloud
events.description:
This is a hands-on event, and best of all, no experience necessary!

We're going to explore the benefits of Python programming in the cloud. Specifically, we'll be using Google's completely free (and simple!) "Colab" environment.

We'll start by going over the basics, then we'll build 2 programs together... one of which is "DeepDream," where we can play around with computer vision and mash up images and styles.

Does it sound complex? I promise it's not. Just bring your laptop, and you'll see.

See you at the library!
events.how_to_find_us: Altadena Library, main branch, in the small conference room on the upper floor

events.name: Cloud Security: SSH to Secure Our Websites!
events.description:
We’re going to have a workshop on how to add SSL certs to our web servers.

This secures our websites from the regular ol’ http, becoming https.

Everything will be guided; it’s simple and free!

events.name: Auto ML - Building Our Own Image Classifiers
events.description:
We’ll be exploring Google Cloud Platform’s AutoML, building our own image classifiers together.

If you’ve never built an image classifier, you’ll be able to keep up. There’s no code to write. We’ll explore how this works, and what the trade offs are from building a complete system ourselves.

events.name: GitLab for Beginners (Source Control for everyone!)
events.description:
We're having a hands-on workshop to make our own git repositories.

If you've wanted to learn about software source control, come and join us. We'll be building our own GitLab repositories together.

As always, just bring a laptop; nothing else is required. And everything we work with is completely free for all!
events.how_to_find_us: 4th floor; take the elevator/stairs that are to the right and behind the main information desk in the lobby

events.name: Git & GitLab for Beginners (Source Control for everyone!)
events.description:
We're visiting Google's Boulder, Colorado office this weekend; please note all regular meetings will always be around good ol' Pasadena, CA! :)

We're having a hands-on workshop to make our own git repositories without the command line!

If you've wanted to learn about software source control, come and join us. We'll be building our own GitLab repositories together.

As always, just bring a laptop; nothing else is required. And everything we work with is completely free for all!
events.how_to_find_us: 4th floor; take the elevator/stairs that are to the right and behind the main information desk in the lobby

events.name: Ionic & Capacitor Workshop
events.description:
We’ll be building an Ionic application together. The back-end is going to be Capacitor.

If you’re new to the topic, you’ll fit in perfectly. There are no pre-req’s.

Just bring your laptop, and we’re going to learn together!

As always, our events are free. You can find us in the top floor of the library, the study area. There’s a stairway to the right of the main lobby desk.

events.name: Cloud Payments - adding the Stripe Elements API to your app
events.description:
We’re going to use the Stripe API to be able to collect payments from a cloud app or website.

If you’ve ever wondered how to monetize an idea, we’re going to cover the in’s and out’s of Stripe payments programmatically.

No pre-reqs, and no prior knowledge required. Just come, learn, and enjoy!

events.name: Firebase Security
events.description:
We’re going to see how easy it can be to secure websites and apps with Firebase authentication.

We’ll be creating a simple website and adding Firebase to take care of our:

Signups,
Logins,
Logouts, and
Password resets.

As always, there’s no prior knowledge needed.

This is going to be a hands-on workshop. Just show up with a laptop, and we’ll be building together!

events.name: How to Work with App Engine
events.description:
Have you ever wanted to build a website or hosted app without having to maintain a server?

We're going to build serverless apps in App Engine to do just that.

As always, zero prior knowledge is expected! Just bring a laptop and join the coding session!

See you soon,
Ryan
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be on the top floor.  You can ask a librarian to point you the in the right direction, or you can walk past their desk on the right, go down the hall, and you'll find the staircase and elevator.  Come all the way up. :)

events.name: Angular 8 and Firebase
events.description:
We're going to play with Angular and see how easy it is to drop in a database and a user login.

No prereq's needed to understand what's going on! You don't need to know one bit of database coding -- it's that easy.

As always, everyone's welcome :)
events.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the top floor of the Pasadena library.  There's an elevator & a staircase to behind the front desk.

events.name: Computer Generated Art
events.description:
We're going to explore a part of AI called Neural Style Transfer. This applies the style of one image onto the content of another.

Want to see your pet as a Picasso? draw your neighborhood like Van Gogh?

We're going to build the program to do it all for us.

As always, everyone's welcome, and no prior knowledge is needed. Just bring a laptop.
events.how_to_find_us: we'll be in the second room (just walk past the register and you'll see)

events.name: (Online) Computer Generated Art
events.description:
This is a social distancing repeat of our most recent in-person event. It'll be on YouTube Live this evening. Link to be posted in the description.

We're going to explore a part of AI called Neural Style Transfer. This applies the style of one image onto the content of another.

Want to see your pet as a Picasso? draw your neighborhood like Van Gogh?

We're going to build the program to do it all for us.

As always, everyone's welcome, and no prior knowledge is needed. See you on YouTube!

organizers.name: Ryan L.
organizers.bio: I love robotics and all thing programming. And my cat.

group_profile.intro: I love robotics and all thing programming.  And my cat.
